Auxlib


Classes

class  auxlib
 wrapper for accessing external functions defined in ATLAS, LAPACK or BLAS libraries More...

00142         int n_rows = out.n_rows;

00144         int info   = 0;

00146         podarray<int> ipiv(out.n_rows);
00147         
00148         // 84 was empirically found -- it is the maximum value suggested by LAPACK (as provided by ATLAS v3.6)
00149         // based on tests with various matrix types on 32-bit and 64-bit machines
00150         //
00151         // the "work" array is deliberately long so that a secondary (time-consuming)
00152         // memory allocation is avoided, if possible
00153         
00154         int work_len = (std::max)(1, n_rows*84);
00155         podarray<eT> work(work_len);
00156         
00157         lapack::getrf_(&n_rows, &n_cols, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), &info);
00158         
00159         if(info == 0)
00160           {
00161           // query for optimum size of work_len
00162           
00163           int work_len_tmp = -1;
00164           lapack::getri_(&n_rows, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), work.memptr(), &work_len_tmp, &info);
00165           
00166           if(info == 0)
00167             {
00168             int proposed_work_len = static_cast<int>(auxlib::tmp_real(work[0]));
00169             
00170             // if necessary, allocate more memory
00171             if(work_len < proposed_work_len)
00172               {
00173               work_len = proposed_work_len;
00174               work.set_size(work_len);
00175               }
00176             }
00177           
00178           lapack::getri_(&n_rows, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), work.memptr(), &work_len, &info);
00179           }
00180         
00181         arma_check( (info > 0), "auxlib::inv_noalias(): matrix appears to be singular" );
00182         }
00183       #else
00184         {
00185         arma_stop("auxlib::inv_noalias(): need ATLAS or LAPACK library");
00186         }
00187       #endif
00188       };
00189     }
00190   }

00306           }

00310       #elif defined(ARMA_USE_LAPACK)
00311         {
00312         basic_mat<eT>& out = X;
00313         
00314         int n_rows = out.n_rows;
00315         int n_cols = out.n_cols;
00316         int info   = 0;
00317         
00318         podarray<int> ipiv(out.n_rows);
00319         
00320         // 84 was empirically found -- it is the maximum value suggested by LAPACK (as provided by ATLAS v3.6)
00321         // based on tests with various matrix types on 32-bit and 64-bit machines
00322         //
00323         // the "work" array is deliberately long so that a secondary (time-consuming)
00324         // memory allocation is avoided, if possible
00325         
00326         int work_len = (std::max)(1, n_rows*84);
00327         podarray<eT> work(work_len);
00328         
00329         lapack::getrf_(&n_rows, &n_cols, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), &info);
00330         
00331         if(info == 0)
00332           {
00333           // query for optimum size of work_len
00334           
00335           int work_len_tmp = -1;
00336           lapack::getri_(&n_rows, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), work.memptr(), &work_len_tmp, &info);
00337           
00338           if(info == 0)
00339             {
00340             int proposed_work_len = static_cast<int>(auxlib::tmp_real(work[0]));
00341             
00342             // if necessary, allocate more memory
00343             if(work_len < proposed_work_len)
00344               {
00345               work_len = proposed_work_len;
00346               work.set_size(work_len);
00347               }
00348             }
00349           
00350           lapack::getri_(&n_rows, out.memptr(), &n_rows, ipiv.memptr(), work.memptr(), &work_len, &info);
00351           }
00352         
00353         arma_check( (info > 0), "auxlib::inv_noalias(): matrix appears to be singular" );
00354         }
00355       #else
00356         {
00357         arma_stop("auxlib::inv_inplace(): need ATLAS or LAPACK");
00358         }
00359       #endif
00360       }
00361     
00362     }
00363   
00364   }

Solve an under-determined system. Assumes that A.n_rows < A.n_cols and B.n_rows = A.n_rows.
